New Records: England chased Oman’s 47 in 3.1 overs – the largest win in men’s T20 World Cup history in terms of balls remaining
Key Match Events: England bowled Oman out in 13.2 overs for only 47, the fourth-lowest score at a T20 World Cup
England finished the match in 102 minutes
Pre-Game Insights: England were in need of a mighty boost to their net run rate and found the perfect opponents in hapless Oman
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler had spoken about concentrating on the win first and foremost and not being consumed by run rates
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a hot and breezy day at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium in North Sound
